title: How to Play PSX Games on a School Computer

steps.headline: Download ePSXe.
steps.description: It is recommended you search a complete version with all the plugins.

steps.headline: Configure the settings and controls to your liking, though be sure not to screw up the program.
Download the games you want.
steps.description: I.e. Resident Evil, Ape Escape, Silent Hill, etc. Just Google the game and type "ISO", "BIN", or "BIOS" at the end.

steps.headline: Compress the files, and save them to a flash drive.
steps.description: If you don't have one available, upload the files to an allowed file sharing site and reclaim them at school.

steps.headline: Save ePSXe to your H:\ drive.
steps.description: If it's not labeled H:\, there should be a network drive you can access from any computer in the school that is labeled otherwise. If there's enough memory, copy your games as well.

steps.headline: When you're ready, open the program, click "File", then "Run ISO" or "Run BIOS" and select the game.

text: Download ePSXe. It is recommended you search a complete version with all the plugins. Configure the settings and controls to your liking, though be sure not to screw up the program.  Download the games you want. I.e. Resident Evil, Ape Escape, Silent Hill, etc. Just Google the game and type "ISO", "BIN", or "BIOS" at the end. Compress the files, and save them to a flash drive. If you don't have one available, upload the files to an allowed file sharing site and reclaim them at school. Save ePSXe to your H:\ drive. If it's not labeled H:\, there should be a network drive you can access from any computer in the school that is labeled otherwise. If there's enough memory, copy your games as well. When you're ready, open the program, click "File", then "Run ISO" or "Run BIOS" and select the game.
